hints: Ancient wonder located in Egypt
Built for Pharaoh Khufu
The oldest and largest of the three pyramids in the Giza Necropolis
Mythical creature with the head of a human and the body of a lion
Located near the Great Pyramid of Giza
Believed to represent Pharaoh Khafre
Vast complex of ancient Egyptian temples and chapels
Located on the east bank of the Nile River in Luxor
Dedicated to the Theban Triad, particularly Amun-Ra
Large ancient Egyptian temple complex located on the east bank of the Nile River in Luxor
Dedicated to the rejuvenation of kingship
Connected to Karnak Temple by an avenue of sphinxes
Valley in Egypt where tombs were constructed for the pharaohs and powerful nobles of the New Kingdom
Includes the tomb of Tutankhamun
Located on the west bank of the Nile River near Luxor
Ancient amphitheater in Rome, Italy
Used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles
Built by the Flavian dynasty
Rectangular forum surrounded by the ruins of several important ancient government buildings at the center of the city of Rome
The hub of ancient Roman public life
Located between the Palatine and Capitoline Hills
Former Roman temple, now a church, in Rome, Italy
Known for its massive concrete dome with a central oculus
Built by Emperor Hadrian
Triumphal arch in Rome, Italy
Erected to commemorate Constantine I's victory at the Battle of Milvian Bridge
Located near the Colosseum
Roman triumphal column in Rome, Italy
Commemorates Emperor Trajan's victory in the Dacian Wars
Known for its continuous spiral bas-relief
Defensive fortification in Great Britain
Built by the Roman Empire across the island
Marked the northern frontier of Roman Britain
Ancient citadel located on a rocky outcrop above the city of Athens, Greece
Home to the Parthenon and Erechtheion
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Former temple on the Athenian Acropolis, Greece
Dedicated to the goddess Athena
A symbol of ancient Greek democracy and architectural excellence
Ancient sanctuary in Greece and site of the Olympic Games
Dedicated to the god Zeus
Home to the Temple of Zeus and the Heraion
Ancient sanctuary and oracle in Greece
Dedicated to the god Apollo
Site of the Pythian Games
Largest Bronze Age archaeological site on Crete, Greece
Believed to be the ceremonial and political center of the Minoan civilization
Associated with the myth of the Minotaur
Former Greek Orthodox Christian patriarchal basilica, later an Ottoman imperial mosque, now a museum in Istanbul, Turkey
Known for its massive dome and mosaics
Built by Emperor Justinian I
Historic mosque in Istanbul, Turkey
Known for its six minarets and blue tiles
Built during the Ottoman Empire
Large palace in Istanbul, Turkey
Served as the main residence and administrative headquarters of the Ottoman sultans
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient Greek city in Anatolia (modern-day Turkey)
Known for the Temple of Artemis, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
An important early center of Christianity
Ancient capital of the Achaemenid Persian Empire
Known for its grand palaces and ceremonial halls
Burned by Alexander the Great
Ivory-white marble mausoleum in Agra, India
Built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of India
Historic fort in Old Delhi, India
Built by Mughal emperor Shah Jahan
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and a symbol of India
Tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India
Considered the first garden-tomb on the Indian subcontinent
A precursor to the Taj Mahal
Minaret and victory tower in Delhi, India
Part of the Qutub Complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Built by Qutb al-Din Aibak, the first Sultan of Delhi
War memorial in New Delhi, India
Commemorates the soldiers of the British Indian Army who died in World War I
A prominent landmark in the city
Arch monument in Mumbai, India
Built to commemorate the landing of King George V and Queen Mary in 1911
A popular tourist attraction
Collection of cave temples on Elephanta Island, near Mumbai, India
Dedicated to the Hindu god Shiva
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Rock-cut Buddhist cave monuments in Maharashtra, India
Known for their ancient frescoes and sculptures
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Rock-cut cave temples and monasteries in Maharashtra, India
Represent Buddhism, Hinduism, and Jainism
Includes the Kailasa Temple, a monolithic rock-cut temple
13th-century CE Sun Temple at Konark, Odisha, India
Designed in the shape of a colossal chariot with twelve pairs of wheels
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Group of monuments in Mahabalipuram, Tamil Nadu, India
Built by the Pallava dynasty
Includes rock-cut temples and monolithic rathas
Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva in Thanjavur, Tamil Nadu, India
Built by Raja Raja Chola I
A magnificent example of Chola architecture
Site of the ancient city of Vijayanagara, Karnataka, India
Known for its extensive ruins of temples, palaces, and other structures
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Buddhist complex in Madhya Pradesh, India
Known for its Great Stupa, one of the oldest Buddhist monuments in India
Built by Emperor Ashoka
Complex of monuments and buildings in Delhi, India
Includes the Qutub Minar, Alai Darwaza, and Iron Pillar
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Series of fortifications built across the historical northern borders of China
Built to protect against nomadic invasions
The longest man-made structure in the world
Collection of terracotta sculptures depicting the armies of Qin Shi Huang
Buried with the first emperor of China
Discovered near Xi'an, China
Imperial palace complex in Beijing, China
Served as the home of Chinese emperors for nearly 500 years
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Imperial complex of religious buildings in Beijing, China
Used by emperors for annual ceremonies of prayer to Heaven for good harvests
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Vast complex of lakes, gardens and palaces in Beijing, China
A masterpiece of Chinese landscape garden design
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Former winter palace of the Dalai Lamas in Lhasa, Tibet, China
A symbol of Tibetan Buddhism and its central role in the traditional administration of Tibet
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Massive stone statue of Maitreya Buddha carved out of a cliff face in Sichuan, China
The largest and tallest stone Buddha statue in the world
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Series of Buddhist cave temples and statues carved into the limestone cliffs near Luoyang, China
Known for their exquisite artistry and historical significance
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
System of 492 temples carved into a cliff near Dunhuang, China
Known for their Buddhist art and manuscripts
A UNESCO World Heritage Site on the Silk Road
Waterfront promenade in Shanghai, China
Known for its historic colonial buildings and views of the Pudong skyline
A symbol of Shanghai's past and present
Communications and observation tower in Tokyo, Japan
Inspired by the Eiffel Tower
The second-tallest structure in Japan
Primary residence of the Emperor of Japan
Located in the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo
Built on the site of the former Edo Castle
Buddhist temple in Kyoto, Japan
Known for its wooden stage that juts out from the main hall
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Shinto shrine in Kyoto, Japan
Known for its thousands of vermilion torii gates
Dedicated to Inari, the god of rice and sake
Buddhist temple complex in Nara, Japan
Houses a massive bronze statue of Buddha (Daibutsu)
Its main hall is the largest wooden building in the world
Memorial park in Hiroshima, Japan
Commemorates the victims of the atomic bombing of Hiroshima in 1945
Includes the Atomic Bomb Dome
Royal palace in Seoul, South Korea
Built in 1395, it was the main royal palace of the Joseon Dynasty
A major historical landmark in Seoul
Buddhist temple in Gyeongju, South Korea
Known for its stone bridges and pagodas
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Massive stone temple complex in Cambodia
Originally a Hindu temple dedicated to Vishnu, later a Buddhist temple
The largest religious monument in the world
Ancient city in Cambodia, near Angkor Wat
Known for its Bayon temple with smiling faces
Served as the last capital of the Khmer Empire
9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Central Java, Indonesia
The world's largest Buddhist temple
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
9th-century Hindu temple compound in Central Java, Indonesia
Dedicated to the Trimurti (Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva)
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient city in Jordan
Known for its rock-cut architecture, especially Al-Khazneh (The Treasury)
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New7Wonders of the World
Walled area within the modern city of Jerusalem
Home to holy sites for Judaism, Christianity, and Islam
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient limestone wall in the Old City of Jerusalem
A holy site for Jews, believed to be a remnant of the Second Temple
Also known as the Kotel
Islamic shrine located on the Temple Mount in the Old City of Jerusalem
Known for its golden dome and octagonal shape
A holy site for Muslims
Church in the Christian Quarter of the Old City of Jerusalem
Believed to contain the two holiest sites in Christianity: the site where Jesus was crucified and Jesus's empty tomb
A major pilgrimage site
Ancient fortification in the Southern District of Israel
Known for its dramatic siege by the Romans in 73 CE
A symbol of Jewish heroism
One of the largest and oldest mosques in the world
Located in Damascus, Syria
Built on the site of a Roman temple and a Christian basilica
Ancient Aramaic city in Syria
Known for its well-preserved Roman ruins, including the Temple of Bel and the Arch of Triumph
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient city in Mesopotamia (modern-day Iraq)
Capital of the Babylonian and Neo-Babylonian Empires
Known for the Hanging Gardens and Ishtar Gate
Eighth gate to the inner city of Babylon
Built by Nebuchadnezzar II
Decorated with glazed bricks depicting dragons and bulls
Massive step pyramid built in the ancient Sumerian city of Ur (modern-day Iraq)
Dedicated to the moon god Nanna
One of the best-preserved ziggurats
Ancient Inca citadel in Peru
Known for its stunning architecture and mountain setting
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New7Wonders of the World
Historic center of the ancient Inca capital in Peru
Known for its Inca and Spanish colonial architecture
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient geoglyphs in the desert plains of Peru
Created by the Nazca culture
Depict animals, plants, and geometric shapes
Ancient Mesoamerican city in Mexico
Known for its massive pyramids, including the Pyramid of the Sun and Pyramid of the Moon
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Large pre-Columbian city built by the Maya civilization in Mexico
Known for its El Castillo pyramid and astronomical observatory
A UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New7Wonders of the World
Ancient Maya city-state in Mexico
Known for its exquisite architecture and sculptures, including the Temple of the Inscriptions
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient Maya walled city on the Caribbean coast of Mexico
Known for its stunning cliffside location and well-preserved ruins
A popular tourist destination
Ancient Maya archaeological site in Honduras
Known for its elaborate stelae and altars
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Large ancient Maya city in Guatemala
Known for its towering pyramids and temples, including Temple I and Temple II
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Ancient city in southeastern Zimbabwe
Known for its impressive dry-stone architecture, including the Great Enclosure
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Town in Ethiopia known for its rock-hewn churches
Carved out of solid rock in the 12th and 13th centuries
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Partially excavated Roman city in Morocco
Known for its well-preserved mosaics and triumphal arch
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Large mud-brick mosque in Djenn√©, Mali
The largest mud-brick building in the world
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Another name for the Sphinx of Giza
Mythical creature with the head of a human and the body of a lion
Located near the Great Pyramid of Giza
Ancient pyramid complex in Egypt
Includes the Great Pyramid of Giza, Pyramid of Khafre, and Pyramid of Menkaure
A UNESCO World Heritage Site
Two massive rock-cut temples in southern Egypt
Built by Pharaoh Ramesses II
Relocated to save them from the rising waters of Lake Nasser
Mortuary temple of Pharaoh Hatshepsut in Egypt
Located at Deir el-Bahari on the west bank of the Nile River
Known for its terraced design
Another name for the Temple of Luxor
Large ancient Egyptian temple complex located on the east bank of the Nile River in Luxor
Dedicated to the rejuvenation of kingship
Another name for the Colosseum
Ancient amphitheater in Rome, Italy
Used for gladiatorial contests and public spectacles
Another name for the Pantheon

Known for its massive concrete dome with a central oculus
Another name for the Roman Forum

Commemorates Emperor Titus's victory in the Jewish War
